Context:
* The text is about ACE Distance courses offered by George Brown College.
* Adult learners who need to prepare for college or improve job opportunities can take these online courses.
* All students must complete a "Learn to Learn" course before enrolling in an ACE Distance course.
* The 20-hour "Learn to Learn" course helps students determine if online learning is suitable, develop personalized training plans, and acquire academic and computer skills.
* Students can register for the "Learn to Learn" course before beginning their ACE Distance studies.
* There are two options for ACE Distance courses: free with limited space (intake takes place in September, November, January, March, April, and June) and paid with more space (intake is in May, July, August, October, December, and February).
* Contact information: George Brown College, 200 King St. E., Rm. 524, Toronto, ON M5A 3W8. Students must send a cheque before the intake begins to register.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/ACE Distance - Preparatory and Liberal Studies | George Brown College.txt

Context: To enroll in ACE Distance programs at George Brown College, contact the ACE Distance team at ext. 6193 or email acedistance@georgebrown.ca. For information about the ACE Online and ACE Certificate, visit the ACE Distance website. Interested in Academic Upgrading classes at the downtown campus? Email upgradinginfo@georgebrown.ca or call ext. 3560. Sign up to receive college news and updates by visiting a specific page and clicking "Sign Up Now". Contact George Brown College's general information at 416-415-2000 or TTY 1-877-515-5559, or email ask.george@georgebrown.ca. Visit the college's Social Media Hub.
